inn1.comm: that one didn't quite come on. Rahane was on the back foot, ready to drill a back of a length delivery into the covers but ended up inside edging it by his feet.
that one certainly did. Smacked through cover! Gentle-paced, short ball, allowing Rahane the freedom to throw his arms at it. Simply stood still and lashed the ball in front of point.

good length from Southee, and not only does it make the batsman uncertain, it gains some outswing as well. Rahane didn't know whether to be forward or back as this ball came at him just outside off. Ended up having to adjust with his hands, reaching a bit away from his body
back of a length and outside off, allowed through to the wicketkeeper. Outswing again from Southee
steps forward, covers the line of the good length ball, and the swing away as he opens the face at the last moment and steers it to point

perhaps he was searching for the old hooping pitch-on-leg-stump-hit-off-stump ball. But he ended up asking too much of the humidity currently in the air, assisting swing. Rahane holds firm in his crease and flicks the ball off his hips to fine leg
and this is a different challenge. Boult brings the ball in, and he does so pitching it full and around off stump. Rahane blocks, but was almost guilty of putting his front leg across too far

superbly hit, gets nicely forward, and presents the full face of the bat against a 138 kph delivery. He was able to time it so well because he pointed his front foot towards mid-on, to direct the ball. Good fielding from Boult in his followthrough
full and outside off - almost the sucker ball - Rahane baps it back to the bowler
132kph, lets the back of a length delivery come on and guides it off the back foot to point

bang! Through the covers again! Flat track. Ball coming onto the bat. Rahane's in his element. He's even been gifted with all the width he could possibly want to get on the front foot and just hit through the line
good length ball at 138 kph, defended
shortish and outside off, Rohit taps it to point with soft hands
a tinge of movement away from the bat, but it began early and Rohit is able to account for it by staying on the back foot and with a defensive bat
fine bowling. He had gone wide of the crease for the outswinger - that seam is bolt upright, and the length is delightfully full. Southee wants Rohit to square up, but he doesn't and defends well

outside edge! All he had to do was pull the length back just a bit, so that Rohit couldn't feel like he could reach the pitch of the ball with his front foot. Tentative push results and the outswing almost does its job
slammed over mid-off as Rohit strides down the pitch, turns a length ball into a half-volley and lofts it over the in-field. Clearly great conditions to bat in
huge appeal for lbw, could it have been sliding down? Southee angled a full delivery into the pads and had Rohit falling over as he tried to flick. Umpire Oxenford shakes his head
132 kph, short of a length delivery angled in towards fourth stump. Rahane went for a late cut, as he does often in one-day cricket, but is too cramped

his inswing seems to be accentuated with the angle from around the stumps. But the thing that did Rahane was the length - it doesn't let Rahane come forward, but he has to because it wasn't short. The batsman tries to play close to his body to limit the damage and gets an inside edge to square leg
waits on a back of a length delivery and steers the ball to point
fuller delivery on off stump, Rahane drills it to mid-on and then points to some problems behind the bowler's arm
gets ready for a flick to fine leg, but the short-pitched delivery may not have come onto him as he had hoped. Perhaps that's the length where some shenanigans can happen. Dig it in
turns this to the left of fine leg, waiting nicely on the ball and positioning himself outside the line of the ball to bring his wrists into play
back of a length and outside off, Rahane was looking to get on top of the bounce and slap it through the covers. Isn't able to
drifts down the pads, Rahane was hoping to glance it away fine and get the maximum out of it, but could not connect
loads up the pull - he's quite good with that shot - and sends the short ball on middle and off stump to the left of long leg. Southee should get his bouncers higher. That was just about chest-high.
114kph, slower ball on middle and leg, Rohit sees it and tucks the ball in front of square leg
invites the drive outside off stump, Rahane is into his shot a bit too early. Inside edge sends the ball back down the pitch
good length ball on off stump, defended
lands the offcutter right up on off stump, Rahane keeps it out
back of a length and outside off, as Boult continues bowling around the stumps, Rohit leaves
good length, teasing Rohit outside off, doesn't want to have anything to do with it. No slips though.

extra bounce beats the outside edge! The ball comes down with a wobbly seam, hits back of a length outside off, which is why Rohit went for the late cut to third man, but it kicks up more than he expects
nudges a length delivery on middle stump past the left of short midwicket
plays a very uncharacteristic shot - a rank slog - against a pretty good length delivery on off stump. Gets an inside edge onto his pads. India seem to be feeling just a bit under pressure
back of a length on off stump, Rahane brings his wrists into play and taps the ball towards short midwicket. Only one run off the over. India going along at a run-rate of 3
starts with a full delivery on middle, Rohit uses the angle and works it to deep square leg
opens the face against a shortish delivery, having come forward, and runs it to backward point
slides a full delivery down the leg side, Rahane had no hope of getting his bat to it though he did try with a flick
back of a length and outside off, Rahane pats the ball to mid-off, and since the fielder is on the edge of the circle, there is opportunity for a quick single
gets up with the short delivery outside off and defuses it to the right of short midwicket. Soft hands. Good thinking to keep the singles going
just short of a good length on off stump, Rahane defends
moves across onto off stump - almost premeditating - so he can nudge a shortish delivery outside off to the vacant square leg region
forces a length ball outside off stump to deep midwicket. Rahane seems to be playing some odd shots right now. Plonks his front leg across and slogs
lets the shortish delivery come on and dabs it to point. Soft hands allows him a simple single. That ball came up at hit Rohit's bat near the handle.

sweet, glorious relief! Boult has been outstanding in this first spell - until this slower ball, which was wide and on the half-volley as well. Rahane sees it early and lifts it over extra cover. He was definitely eager to get on that.
back of a length and outside off, taps it down

the wicketkeeper can't reach it! The length ball was angled into middle and leg, then it seamed further away. Rahane tries a leg glance to no avail. Watling really should have got there, but he only put in a dive, without moving his feet towards the ball
good length on off stump, defended to point
opens the face and glides the shortish delivery to deep third man. Twelve runs off the over. Would help these two settle
fuller delivery just outside off, defended. Seems the slower ball too.
length ball outside off, driven to the left of cover, where Neesham puts in a dive. Got a bad bounce, but got his body behind it
full delivery on off stump, Rahane works it to long-on. Roll of the wrists to drag the ball over

no messing around! Rohit reads the slower ball, shifts his weight back and heaves it with the offcut to deep midwicket. Santner patrols that boundary, running a long way to his left and doing extremely well to stop the boundary. He was right on the edge when he stuck out his left hand
moves back and flicks a shortish delivery on off stump through square leg
gets forward and blocks a good length ball outside off to point and throws a wry grin at his partner.
slants the full ball down leg, Rohit flicks it to deep square leg

chips it straight to short midwicket! The most innocuous of deliveries. Full on middle. There for the flick. But he has not timed the ball. It's that old weakness of his, unable to force the pace when the pitch becomes slow. He was not quite to the pitch of the ball, it held up on the surface a bit and he didn't make much of an effort the keep it down. The ball didn't come on, he found Latham
squared up first ball! It's fullish on off stump, wobbling away just a bit, Kohli closes the bat face, looking for a single into the leg side, gets a leading edge to point
shuffles across outside off and pats a shortish delivery to the right of short midwicket. Enough for Kohli to scamper across for a quick single
fuller delivery on off stump, driven to mid-off. That was the offcutter

short and wide, Rohit bashes it to the point boundary. One-bounce. Nothing held back. Opportunities like this would ease India's tension. Not least because this pitch would only slow down further and become harder for batting in the second innings provided there is no dew
starts with a shortish delivery on middle, Kohli rocks back and drills it to the left of long-off
huge turn. Big appeal for lbw Rohit had gone so far back and was right in front. But did it pitch outside leg? Yes. Top call from umpire Oxenford.
now that he knows there is turn, Rohit plays with it, opening the face to point
flighted delivery on the stumps, defended
rocks back and thumps a flatter delivery to extra cover
shortish again and Rohit moves back, allowing himself the time to read the turn - slow turn - and flick it to the right of short midwicket
back of a length and outside off, Rohit tries to steer the ball behind point, but the man has been placed really well
wanted to nudge the shortish delivery off his pads to square leg. Does do so, but off the pad because the angle of the ball coming in was a bit acute
sweet timing! Kohli gets the flick going, leaning over the fuller delivery on leg stump and watching the ball fly away to deep midwicket

that's how you deal with a slow pitch. This was the offcutter, pitched short and just a shade outside off. Rohit had played this very ball to point earlier in the over. This time he shifts his weight back and powers the ball over mid-off. So powerful was the strike that it went for six. Leaves Kohli open-mouthed
fuller delivery outside off, driven to mid-off
moves back to a flatter delivery on leg stump, accounts for the turn and pats the ball into the covers. Point has to run in, and to his right, by which time Kohli is safely at the non-stirkers'
defends a length delivery from the crease
a tad short, so Rohit gives himself some room to cut the ball. There's a sweeper on the boundary though. Neesham moves quickly to his left and keeps it to a single
now Neesham has to move to his right, with Kohli driving through the covers. Beat the man inside the circle. Wanted two, but Rohit, wisely, says no
fuller delivery outside off, driven to long-off

almost carries back to the bowler. Flat delivery on middle and leg. Kohli rocked back to flay it through the off side, but the ball holds up in the pitch and makes him hit down the ground instead. Santner has to move to his left, and forward a bit, but the ball bounces in front of his dive
"nice start, Ish" says Watling behind the stumps as a flighted delivery outside off is driven to long-off

stays back to a good length ball and flicks it between square leg and midwicket. Kohli was intent on a couple, but he loses his footing and falls at the non-strikers' end. Could have injured his ankle. No spikes on his heels
flighted just outside off, defended
slow, juicy short ball outisde off, Rohit pulls it to the square leg boundary. He's using pure power to outdo the effects of a slow pitch
shortish and outside off, cut behind point for a couple.
oooh, that keeps low! Sodhi pushes it through on middle, there is some turn as well, which is why Rohit, flicking the ball, gets a leading edge down the pitch
tossed up just outside off, driven to mid-off
gets inside the line to drive a flighted delivery outside off through point
pushes the flatter delivery on off stump to long-off
well bowled. That was a bit slower, and drifted into middle and leg. Kohli came forward to drive, had to think again and blocks towards point
moves back and flicks a length ball to the right of midwicket
looped up and angled so far into the batsman that it pitches outside leg. Rohit goes inside out with a drive to long-off. Not entirely solidly. That's drinks.
back of a length on middle stump, makes a bit of room and punches to short extra cover
a touch too short and wide, but it spins away sharply, and Rohit finds himself too far from the ball to cut with any power, ends up checking his shot to slap it out to deep point
tossed up full outside off, Kohli drives powerfully back down the ground, in the air, and Sodhi gets his hands to it in his follow-through, to his left, at around waist height, and drops it.
flighted ball on middle, whipped to long-on

slow flight on off stump, and Rohit doesn't care that long-off is back, just clears his front leg and launches that high, back over the bowler's head, and clears the boundary to the long-off fielder's right
short outside off, opens his bat face to guide it to the left of short third man. Anderson does well to chase back to the boundary and cut it off with a sprawling pull-back
in the blockhole on middle and leg, clipped to short midwicket
very full on middle stump, shows the full face to push towards long-off
full on middle, Rohit pushes to mid-on, who's stationed slightly deepish, and takes off for a quick single
full on middle and off, punched to long-off
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
slower ball angling in to middle and leg. Rohit gets his front pad out of the way and dabs defensively towards point
good length ball, turning sharply away, Rohit avoids it
the flight makes Rohit reach for the ball outside off, drives to cover
that wasn't entirely short, but Rohit has jumped back in his crease and lashes the ball behind point. Outstanding manipulation of length to get to his fifty
good length ball outside off, eased towards point. Kohli was sprinting down for a single, but was sent back with Rohit not feeling 100% with his leg injury. Kohli apologises

slog sweep into the crowd at deep midwicket! That was ripe for the picking, with Sodhi tossing the ball up and offering room to free the arms. What do they say about those batsman playing with injury again?

smeared through the covers. India have been getting the boundaries a lot more frequently in the second set of 10 overs. This was a slower ball - offcutter - but Kohli has lurched down the pitch so quickly, meets it almost on the half-volley and places it to the left of the man inside the circle and to the right of the sweeper
looks to exploit the vacancy at third man for a single, but he is beaten by the back of a length ball outside off
waits on this shortish delivery outside off and steers it behind point with a relatively straight bat

almost swung himself off his feet... all for an inside edge. Rohit saw a length ball outside off and wanted to slog it to the next planet. Ish Sodhi does really well to chase the ball down and flick the ball back, inches away from the fine leg boundary
fuller delivery on off stump, Rohit pushes to long-on and jogs to the other end
fuller delivery on leg stump, Kohli drives it to long-off
stands up tall behind a shortish delivery outside off and drills it to the sweeper
uses the pace on offer as he hangs back and offers a ramp for the shortish delivery outside off to hit and go to third man
moves outside off to flick a length ball to deep square leg

makes room outside leg, Boult follows him and cramps the batsman for room as he tries to hit through the line. Inside edge to fine leg. Takes a single and settles down on his haunches, worried about his leg
fuller delivery outside off, Kohli goes for the on-the-up cover drive. He too gets an inside edge through square leg. Played too early
rises with the short delivery on off stump and guides it to deep third man

picks the gap between third man and backward point - both inside the circle. Considering that it was pretty poor that Neesham begins with a really wide delivery. Rohit was on the back foot, reaches for the ball and pokes it through
another late cut, but this time it is close enough to short third man for Sodhi to move to his right and stop the boundary. Stops the single too, with Kohli sending Rohit back with a big grin.
another shortish delivery on off stump sent to Sodhi at short third man. Takes a shy at the striker's end, Rohit's end, considering he had taken a few steps down, and is batting with an injured leg

has Taylor dropped another key Indian batsman? He has. At short midwicket, he has to move to his right to get behind a mistimed slog from Rohit. It came at a decent pace, decent height. But it doesn't stick. Unfortunate for Neesham, who had deceived the set batsman with a slower ball. Taylor dropped Kohli on 6 in Mohali, he made 154 to win the game.
legcutter outside off, defended
back of a length and outside off, pushes into the covers
cuts to the sweeper cover, doesn't quite time the shortish delivery outside off
tries to flick this towards midwicket, but the short ball gets perhaps a bit too big for Kohli to manoeuvre it
opens the face against a back of a length delivery and finds a single at deep third man
full on off stump, Rohit - staying rooted to the crease, that leg seems to be limiting his movement - pushes to the left of short midwicket

top edge, but it lands a few feet in front and to the left of Neesham at deep midwicket. Boult goes back over the wicket, for a cross-seamed bouncer, lures Rohit into a pull but he does not time it. Ends up helping him by keeping the ball away from the fielder
the bouncer gets him! This is at full pace. Rising above Rohit's chest. Cramping him for room. The batsman goes for the pull, but top edges it and it is pouched safely by Neesham at deep midwicket
full and into the pads, Dhoni wants to nudge it to midwicket. Wears it on the pads instead
short ball, patted through to the sweeper cover
full on off stump, firmly defended
well bowled. He has seen Kohli running down the pitch and fires a full delivery wide outside off stump. Kohli has to reach for it with an open face and gets a single to deep point
full on off stump, pushed to mid-off
works a full delivery on middle to short midwicket
tossed up on off stump, drilled to the left of long-off
long hop outside off, Dhoni stays back and hacks it to the left of long-off. Pure, blistering power. Boult does well to run across and save the boundary
tossed up outside off, Kohli drives it through extra cover
looped up well outside off, Dhoni avoids it, perhaps looking for a wide. Just inside the line
that short ball seems to hold up, and Dhoni, going for the cut, mistimes the ball into the covers
flighted on off stump, defended into the covers
flighted on leg stump, nudged through midwicket
moves back to crunch a flatter delivery on off stump to long-on

almost had Dhoni. The turn made him square up as he went deep in his crease to try and flick the ball with the angle. It had pitched on leg and veers away to off stump, takes a bit of an edge to point
pushes it to the right of cover
went down for a sweep, but Santner slows the ball down to make sure Dhoni doesn't have much pace to work with. He brings his bat down like an axe on top of the ball to find a single behind square leg
driven through the covers off the front foot
ooooh, point was not too far away from that as Kohli is deceived by a big, turning legbreak, holding on the pitch and bouncing more than he expects. Cut shot pierces the infield though
flighted outside off, Kohli drives it sweetly to the right of the sweeper
stays back and cuts to point

stays leg side of the ball and drives the flighted delivery outside off through the covers. Easy single on offer, but there seemed to be some hesitation. No idea why. These two run so well with each other that it tempts the notion of telepathic connection
flighted outside off, sent to long-off
good work from Guptilll, anticipating the drive with the ball tossed up. He moves to his right at cover to stop a single
opens the face as he drives in the air to cover point. Santner continues to target leg stump, which makes the balls turning away a threat
leans forward and flicks it to the right of midwicket
pinned him to the crease with a quicker delivery on off stump. Dhoni opens the face to third man.

run-out chance!. Dhoni flicks a flighted delivery off his pads. Bracewell, the substitute, got to the ball quickly at square leg, diving forward to grab the ball with his right hand, but as he went to throw it, the ball gets stuck and doesn't fly towards the stumps as it was supposed to. Kohli puts in a full-length dive, but not sure he would have made it.
flatter and quicker on leg stump, Kohli goes back to flick, but the ball holds its line and hits him on the pads
pushed to cover
flighted delivery on off stump, defended
backs away and tries to cut to cover. Mistimes it
slaps the short delivery to sweeper cover
goes back to a shortish delivery on off stump and punches it to long-on
big turn beats the outside edge. Made worse perhaps by the fact this was a good length ball, which demanded the batsman to get forward. Dhoni followed the turn of the ball and is lucky not to nick it
drills it to long-on
stays back and nudges the shortish delivery to midwicket
flighted on middle and off, defended with bat in front of pad
steps down the track and nudges a ball on leg stump to the left of short fine leg
gets inside the line and drives serenely through the covers. The man inside the circle dives to his right, but can't get to it

powerful sweep! He has picked the perfect ball to do so. It was quick. It was tailing down leg. He put his front leg outside off to give himself the leverage, and avoid lbw. Fine leg is up. So it's all about power
pushed into the off side
beats the outside edge! Magnificent bowling. He has tossed the ball up, drew Kohli into the expansive cover drive. The ball dips, turns sharply and goes into the wicketkeeper's gloves
down the track, smashes it down the  ground. Head still, and low, watching the ball. Hands have the room to swing free. Muscled away
works it to long-on

belted into the sightscreen! He has put up a half-volley for Dhoni to clear the front leg and hit straight through the line. For all the hubbub about Dhoni slowing the game down, India are still going at over 5 per over
flighted outside off, driven to extra cover
beaten as Dhoni lunges forward to a good length delivery outside off and is left behind by the dip and turn
back of a length on off stump, Kohli pushes it to the left of short midwicket, where Taylor misfields and yelps out an expletive
back of a length and outside off, punched to mid-off
back of a length on off stump and with no room to work with Dhoni hits the ball back to Southee. His intentions, originally, had been to flick into the leg side

another shortish delivery on off stump, Dhoni tries to stay beside it and punch into the off side. But Williamson has got his fielders up to prevent the single. Three on the off side. Good work from New Zealand. Dhoni now 16 off 32
nudges a shortish delivery to deep square leg and gets through for a couple of runs, despite the fielder being Santner, who has a rocket arm
slower, shortish delivery on off stump, turned behind square leg. That's drinks
lunges forward a long way for the sweep but the ball pitches outside off and turns away, and Dhoni leaves
bit fuller outside off, Dhoni drives gently to cover this time
much shorter and flatter, Dhoni goes back to slap it to leg but doesn't midlde and inds midwicket
beats him again! Beauty outside off, makes Dhoni come forward with the teasing length and Dhoni pokes and misses as it turns away
there comes the six after the four dot balls! Sodhi Pitches it up a bit too much and Dhoni swings hard at it to loft that over long-off!
the shorter one now from Sodhi, Dhoni goes back quickly to whip it to deep midwicket

starts with a short and slow offcutter headed towards the leg side, but it's too short and Dhoni gets enough time to go across a bit and then guide it fine on the leg side by closing the face of the bat. Smart placement
the legcutter this time from Southee, much better length and Dhoni pushes it back
errs towards the leg side again, Dhoni helps it to long leg for one
shuffles down for the short of length ball, no room at all and Kohli defends it down to mid-on
length delivery on the off side now and Kohli helps it easily to long-on for one
slow offcutter to end the over too, Dhoni stays back and tucks it to fine leg to keep strike
angling in from outside off, Dhoni closes the bat to defend to the leg side

extremely hard catch put down! Slower ball from Anderson, off short of length, Dhoni waited and pushed it down but mistimed it and the ball went to the right of the bowler. Anderson flung himself parallel to the ground, got a hand to it but couldn't hold on to it
that's some salt on that wound. Errs a bit to the leg side, Dhoni knows the field well and places it very well on the leg side towards square for another four

excellent running from these two - not much room, not a poor ball and Dhoni simply tucked the length ball that was angling in with soft hands to the leg side, giving him and Kohli enough time to come back for the second
attempts to open the face to find some runs at third man, but he is beaten by the slower ball
in the air, as Kohli plays a flick, but is surprised  by the offcutter holding on the pitch, and bouncing a lot more than the batsman expects. Came up above his stomach. Single at midwicket
eased through point, standing back to adjust to the shortish length.
charges out to meet the length ball on off stump. He had made his own room to facilitatate the cover drive. But he mistimes the ball off the toe-end
slower ball on middle and off, Kohli waits on it and clips it to the left of short fine leg. Asks for a change of bat
finds the gap between point and extra cover, to take a single off a back of a length delivery on middle
gets up on his toes to flick a short delivery angled into him to deep square leg
shortish delivery angled into middle and leg, Kohli moves back to cut, gets a thick edge to short third man
back of a length on leg stump, pushed to long-on
short ball on off stump, fiercely slapped through to long-off. Guptill did his best, diving to his right from extra cover. No chance
looped up on off stump, driven to the right of Guptill, and this time he slides across to it.
good length on off stump, Kohli drives past Guptill diving to his right to long-off. No Kohli asks for a change of gloves. It's very humid, and he's sweating profusely
flighted on off stump, defended.
good length, slower ball on off stump, Kohli finds a single at cover.
goes short, just outside off, Dhoni doesn't care for it
shortish on off stump, met with a straight bat

well bowled. Dhoni had given his intentions away by jumping down the track too early and Boult countered by firing it at his toes, making sure the ball allowed no room for him to work with. The India captain steers it to point
shortish, and outside off. Dhoni sways away from it. And the ball - since it was slower too - drops short of the wicketkeeper. Watling fumbles and allows a bye
full on off stump, pushed to long-on. Only three runs from the over. Could well be the end of this spell for him, so India will feel pleased they haven't lost a wicket to him
flighted outside off, pushed into the covers

tossed up on off stump, flayed to long-on to get to his 38th ODI fifty. Raises his bat to the crowd, and throws a thumbs up at Dhoni, who insists on walking across and patting his match-winner on the back

pinned in front! Went for the sweep, but he has chosen a bad ball to do so. It was too straight. Slow as well, which meant he was finished with the shot by the time it hit his front pad. And worse, it straightened after angling in, pitching on middle. Fairly easy decision for Nandan, on his ODI debut as an umpire.
beautifully bowled. It's slow and tossed up on off stump. Pandey drives towards point.
flighted into middle and leg, defended towards square leg
gets inside the line of the ball and drives to the right of cover. Guptill prevents the single

starts with a terrible delivery and Kohli makes the most of it. He had to beat extra cover inside the circle. Placed it a yard or so to his left. After that he had to beat long-off and the sweeper. Bisects them perfectly. Classy
short delivery, stays low on middle, Kohli flicks it to long-on
deceived him with change of pace! He had looped the ball up as well, drawing Pandey into an inside-out cover drive. Beats him comfortably

goes for a slog sweep, hitting against the turn with the ball tossed up and outside off. He top-edges it and the ball picks out midwicket with annoying precision for Pandey. Not the cleverest shot with Kohli at the other end, more so having secured a boundary earlier in the over. Was he trying to break the shackles on him after being beaten in the last ball?
goes for a cut, but again Kohli's efforts are foiled by the ball keeping low
flighted outside off, defended to the right of point for a quick single. Makes the new batsman Jadhav work overtime for that. Demands him to do so. Kohli knows it's all on him now
flighted on middle and leg, clipped towards midwicket
flighted on off stump, Jadhav eases it to the left of cover for a single. Simple. And exactly what's needed
flighted on off stump, driven to long-off, past the bowler's left
flighted on middle and off, leans forward and clips it towards midwicket
another slow, loopy delivery on off stump, defended
goes for the cut, but the ball sneaks under the bat. Good work from Watling to get down and keep the ball

"two," he yelled the second he came down the track to a length ball outside off and tapped it to the left of where midwicket would have been. But Anderson, from long-on, has raced in and causes enough doubts. Jadhav eventually says no
and that means no easy singles for the new batsman - Jadhav tries to run the shortish delivery on off stump to point, but Guptill swoops down on it nicely
pulls the short ball from middle stump to the left of deep midwicket. That was offcutter as well. Kohli makes sure to drag Jadhav for a second
that's the slower bouncer, Jadhav avoids it in the hopes of it being called wide for height. He suggests it went well above his head. Umpire at square leg though says it is fine, and one for the over
slower ball, short in length, and outside off. Jadhav pulls and mistimes it to the right of midwicket. He was deceived by the lack of pace
legcutter just outside off, Kohli comes down the track and taps it behind point to retain strike.
flighted onto off stump, Kohli defends, opening the face. Single at point.
beaten as Santner bowls a quicker one just outside off and gets it to bounce more than Jadhav expects. Cut shot in vain
top shot! It was only a fraction short, but he exploited it by moving right back in his crease, cuts the ball between short third man and backward point
clipped through to deep midwicket.
stays beside the good length ball - pushed through outside off - and glides it to short third man

excellent placement to the right and in front of long-on! This is remarkable batting. Kohli knows he can't quite force the pace on this pitch. So he leans forward to a flighted delivery and plants it in a gap where he can get two. Santner knows this trick, so he chases after the ball himself. Even then, it's no use
shortish delivery outside off, pulled to deep square leg
slower bouncer on off stump, it rises up over Kohli's head on off stump as he charged down the track. The batsman turns the bat fully vertical and hacks the ball to long-on
smashed to the long-off boundary. That was at top pace, and it helps Jadhav hit through the line.
but when he takes the pace off, and keeps the length short and the line straight the only shot on offer is the pull. Jadhav fails to connect. Even if he had, there are men in the deep
low full toss outside off, after a roll of Jadhav's wrists, and finds itself deep midwicket.
back of a length and outside off, worked to the right of long-on

picks out long-off! He was placed wider, keeping in mind Kohli's ability to hit those inside out drives. That is the shot he goes for. Came down the track, took the ball on the half-volley and seemed to have struck it so well. The problem was it was straight at Guptill, who is perhaps New Zealand's best fielder. Kohli is livid as he walks off.
stays back and flicks to midwicket. That travelled in the air a bit.
gets set up for the cut shot, but the ball wasn't entirely short, and it turns sharply in at Axar, cramping him for room. Only a single to cover
made to reach as this short ball spins quite a distance outside off. Makes contact with the bottom of the bat to flat bat it to long-on
stays back and flicks the flatter delivery on off stump to midwicket
shortish and outside off, cut to point. That's the end of Sodhi's spell, 2-66.
width outside off, Axar slices it to point
full on off stump, whipped to long-on
moves around the stumps for a back of a length delivery outside off, Jadhav steers it to short third man
back of a length on off stump, nudged towards square leg
flicks a flatter delivery from outside off through to deep square leg

much needed for India. But it could well have gone against them too. Anderson had bowled a perfectly straight ball, heading for middle. Axar had planted his front leg across and could have been lbw had he not got bat to it. As such, however, he got enough bat to beat short fine leg

back of al ength on off stump, Jahdav nudges it to the right of the pitch and went for a single. Neesham veers across to pick up the ball and flings in a throw at the strikers' end. Direct hit would have hand him

single to point, and an overthrow to long-on. Good work from Jadhav to steer the ball with the open face when he was cramped up so badly. Then great work from Axar to recognise the opportunity for an extra run
goes for the slower short ball, and Jadhav, attempting to scoop the ball over fine leg, misses it
worked away behind square leg
shortish on leg stump, worked away to short fine leg
takes all the pace off the short ball, Jadhav pulls it, but with fine leg up, he is disappointed to not place it well enough for a boundary
top work from Guptill, this pull shot was going beyond him at deep square leg, and had it gone even a few inches further, it would have been four. Puts in a dive, gets to it with both hands
slower ball - cuts back in at Jadhav - he does well to dab it to the left of short third man. The lack of pace on the ball means he has to settle for a single
full on middle stump, Axar drives it back down the pitch. Southee gets a hand to it .
another short ball that has no pace and again it gets the best of the batsman. Jadhav looks to pull, knowing fine leg is up, but he can't make contact.

legcutter now, with plenty of width, Jadhav goes for the cut, having waited for the ball, having spotted the variation, but in his attempt to hit the ball as hard as he could, he hit it in the first place
that ball was coming in at his stumps, but Jadhav has remained composed as he gets beside the ball and dabs it to short third man to retain strike
beats him first up. Jadhav was rooted to the crease, on leg stump and Boult, bowing around the stumps, puts the offcutter beyond his reach outside off. Cut and miss.
full on middle, Jadhav whips it to deep midwicket
falls short of long-off running in and to his right. Axar gets an overpitched delivery and he wanted to hoist it straight down the ground. Mistimes it as the bat face turns on contact
full on off stump, Axar drives it to long-off
offcutter - aimed at off stump - Jadhav was looking to glide it to third man, but gets an inside edge through midwicket
low full toss on middle, Axar slugs it down to deep midwicket
short and outside off, with Southee moving around the stumps to the left-hander, pulled to long-on
whacks a slow bouncer, rising above his left shoulder, to deep midwicket
slogs at a length ball that refuses to come onto the bat. Goes off the toe to short third man. Run-making, quickly, will be very hard on this pitch
short ball outside off, pulled to deep square leg
bashed down the ground. Vital hit for India. Axar is a good strike, especially straight, and he gets the chance to do so with Southee bowling short and wide and letting the batsman get under the ball
shortish slower ball outside off, dabbed to short third man
half-volley on middle and leg, heaved to long-on
soars over long-on. That's a glorious hit! Jadhav comes down the track, gets under the offcutter and bullies it over the boundary.
advances again and hacks the shortish delivery to long-on

inside edge onto the stumps. Boult has pulled off a very difficult delivery with relative ease. It was the offcutter, but it is put in the blockhole. Axar tries to slice the ball to third man with a horizontal bat, but ends up dragging on
full on leg stump, works it to vacant midwicket for a single
comes down, makes room, whacks the yorker to long-on and gets a couple to finish the innings off

inn2.comm: good length ball just outside off, Guptill is wary of the outswing, especially with two slips in play. Avoids it
back of a length and the line is a lot wider outside off, simple decision to leave
back of a length ball on fourth stump, pushes Guptill back and makes him play a half-hearted push to point

hard to play those. Don't look Martin, don't look back. Or in front where Yadav is leaping about in wild celebration. Deserves his moment under the spot light though after providing the early wicket with an absolute peach. It was pitched on a good length. It had been angled it. It had Guptill rooted to the crease, trying to block into the leg side. But the away movement squares him up, grazes the pad and then topples off stump
gets up on top of the shortish delivery on middle and leg and clips it to deep square leg

outside edge, but Williamson has not allowed it to carry to Rahane at first slip. Top bowling from Yadav. Lines it up on a good length just outside off, the batsman is a bit legside of the ball to handle it well. So he softens his hands as he tries to defend
good shot. Gets up on top of a shortish delivery outside off and drills it to cover

fantastic work from Mandeep at cover! Shimmies towards the batsman, then has to leap to his left to stop a firm punch off the back foot. He's on the field for Rohit, who had injured his leg while batting.
pushed into the covers
goes for a flick, should have gone along the ground behind square leg, but the ball holds up on the pitch and makes the ball go the infield
shortish and outside off, Latham is loathe to reach out but he is made to. Steers it gingerly to past point
fuller delivery on off stump, has to deal with the unforgiving, straight bat of Williamson

moves around the stumps for a length ball on middle and leg, Latham attempts a flick, it hits the pad and goes to Dhoni behind the stumps. The India captain dives to his right to make sure it doesn't go for extras
back of a length and outside off, left alone
the bat face turns on impact as Latham works a good length ball to the left of mid-on. I think he slipped while turning for a second run. Makes it through though.
142kph, back of a length on off stump, defended under his eyes.

superb timing! And that's not easy to do on this pitch. He has to wait for the ball, has to make sure the ball is in his area before he flicks it. Placed it between short midwicket and the man finer, behind him
tailing into the legs again and Latham whips it to the square leg boundary. Effortless shot. These two are New Zealand's in-form batsmen. They'll have to take the innings deep.
gets up off his toes to try and work a shortish delivery from outside off wide of mid-on. Can't hit the gap
pins him to the crease with a good length ball on off stump. The angle into the right-hander makes it slightly hard to line Bumrah up
beats him by making a short of a length delivery hold its line outside off. Williamson was back and across for a cover drive, but he doesn't account for the late deviation.
fired into the pads, Williamson tries to flick it away but doesn't make any connection

he's been looking for the backfoot punch, now he's got the perfect ball. Short, with a little room, and he pounces. Gets back and across and exploits a yawning gap in the covers. High elbow. Straight bat. Pristine
back of a length and outside off, Williamson hangs back to cut, mistimes it in front of point

despite Jayant's dive at fine leg, Latham's placed this little leg glance well enough to earn himself a boundary. Umesh continues bowling around the stumps to the left-hander and he strays too far down leg
shortish and outside off, pushed to mid-off
gets behind a shortish delivery on off stump
fuller delivery outside off, driven to the left of cover. That's because his bat face closes on impact, which in turn is because he was into the shot too early
pierces the gap at cover. There were two men very close together in there to control the runs off this very shot, but he still gets it through. Brilliant balance.

big appeal for lbw, but could there have been an inside edge? Not really. The impact with pad was slightly outside off. Umpire Nandan says no straight away. Umesh bowls it full, gets the inswing going, and it's good enough to deceive Latham who was defending down the wrong line, outside where the ball ended up
good length ball on off stump, at 136 kph, defended towards slip
opens the face and guides a shortish delivery towards Rahane at slip
stays back to a shortish delivery outside off as he punches to the right of cover. Contact was with the bottom of the bat
turns a shortish delivery to mid-on, working the angle of the bowler from around the stumps
135kph, stays in line of a shortish delivery on middle and off stump

pops it to mid-on! Jayant whoops having made his little contribution on debut, picking up the catch. Latham goes for a flick through midwicket, but this back of a length ball has held up on the pitch, and takes the leading edge. I wonder if this was a plan, making the bowler go around the stumps to keep Latham playing the flick and hoping for a ball - like this one - to misbehave
just a shade short of a good length and outside off, Williamson plants his front leg across to cover his stumps and leave
fuller delivery outside off, firmly defended
invests in playing back though the ball was rather full. The width affords him a steer to point
full and wide outside off, Williamson went for the cover drive but cannot catch up with it
full on off stump, driven back at the bowler
it is relatively easy when the ball is a half-volley. Williamson gets his front foot towards the ball and then hits through the line. The cover drive hits the gap to the left of mid-off

and he shows his ability off the back foot now. Moves across, to get close to the ball to control it better. He keeps it down, picks the gap between cover and point. Though that reduces the room that other batsmen may prefer, Williamson has timing on his side.
that didn't look good. Taylor's front leg had gone across on off stump, and the inswinger could well have had him lbw. This time though his hands are quick enough to avoid that fate
fuller delivery just outside off, defended
back of a length on off stump, holds on the pitch as well, Taylor adjusts with his wrists to keep the ball down to midwicket
plays a late cut to a shortish delivery that wasn't affording him too much width. Fast hands from Taylor.
gets on top of a good length ball on off stump. Head over the ball, bat face pointing down.
tries to flick a back of a length delivery from outside off, but holds himself back realising this is not the pitch to be dragging balls like that. Plays it back to the bowler
good length delivery outside off, Taylor thinks it is short and goes back to cut. Inside edges it. The ball barely goes past Dhoni
shortish and outside off, Taylor makes room and cuts the ball behind point, hoping to pick the gap. But Mandeep dives to his left and gives away only a single

he would have been run-out at the non-strikers' end! Williamson hits it to the right of cover, where Kohli does very well. Swoops on the ball and flings in a quick throw, off balance. The only problem is it is a little too wide for the bowler to collect. The NZ captain had given up, his head thrown up in the air.
flighted on off stump, Taylor brings his bat down in an arc from gully and gets a leading edge as he defends
another outside edge as Axar darts the ball in at Taylor, forcing him to play into the leg side, but with his backlift coming from gully, it looks ungainly
pushed into the covers
shortish and outside off, steered to deep third man
shortish and outside off, Taylor cuts to point
slashes a length ball through backward and cover points. Room on offer, pace on offer and that's Taylor's happy place.
drives into the covers, looking for a single. Williamson took a few paces as well, slips, creating panic amongst his supporters, but is back in time for Mandeep's throw

full and tailing into the pads, Taylor works it to the right of midwicket, easy single on offer but there is indecision in the running again. Williamson wasn't keen on it, though Taylor was always coming. Axar is the man who made the NZ captain nervous, diving away.
full on off stump, driven to mid-on
loads of turn and it is threatening because he bowls quickly. Angles it in, pitches on a good length, pulls Taylor into a block and beats the outside edge
goes back and slices the ball to backward point
quicker delivery, at 91 kph, full on off stump, driven back at Axar
stays beside the flighted ball as he drives to long-off
cuts from the stumps, which is usually a risk against Axar, who is capable of sneaking in quick arm balls. This time though Williamson is able to deflect the ball to point
tossed up, WIlliamson is forward to defend
starts with a short one, which Taylor cuts behind point. Good footwork. Moving back and away from the ball to give himself room
backs away and cuts another flat delivery though to the sweeper

chance, but a little too wide of short cover! Williamson is on the back foot, looking for that cover drive, but the good length ball holds in the pitch and messes with him. Lucky that the ball went to the fielder's right
flatter and quicker on middle and off, Taylor whips it back at the bowler
moves back and cuts towards point
goes back and punches a shortish delivery to long-on
flighted onto off stump - and it comes on with the arm. Williamson defends
flighted outside off, Williamson drives inside out to short cover
reaches for the length ball that turns well away from him, and finds Kohli lurking at backward point

cuts from the stumps, and manages to get it past Kohli's right. Definite risk in playing a shot like that - if he missed the ball, he would have been bowled. But Williamson backed himself, having made a little room to go through with it
goes back as the shortish delivery doesn't turn, Williamson works it to short midwicket
good length ball on off stump, defended
well played. He waited for the ball to turn, and then planted an open face in line with it to pick up a single at third man
moves back and flicks the ball from the stumps behind square leg. Bumrah misfields, but there was always one there
nicely bowled. Mishra looped the ball up on off stump, Taylor waits and pats it to the left of cover
goes back, gets up tall and drills a short delivery to long-on
wide of the crease for a flighted delivery on off stump, defended
looped up on off stump, driven inside out to deep cover
a bit too full and a bit too straight, so Taylor going back to punch the ball means he can hit it back to the bowler only
how has he survived that? A quick, spinning delivery stays low and Taylor going back to cut made it a lot hard on himself. Manages enough connection to place it in front of point
good length ball pitching on off stump - this one bounces a bit more than he expects - but Williamson is able to handle it with soft hands

the inside out drive.... straight to long-off! Good bowling from Axar. He slows this down, tosses it up, draws Williamson into playing an expansive shot. Was he looking to chip it over the infield? Was he trying to place it wide of the man in the deep? He fails in both as Jadhav runs to his left and takes a fine, tumbling catch. India celebrate a huge wicket.
gets to the pitch, makes room and drives to long-off
good length ball outside off, Neesham moves back and across to block
flighted just outside off, driven into the covers
beautiiful placement. Admittedly the ball was very wide outside off, so he moved across to it and gently steered it to the right of short third man
pushed through on off stump, Taylor drives to point. No single

he's walking. Goes for a cut shot, but Mishra gets a little more bounce than Taylor expects. Only the smallest mistake. But that's all you get sometimes. The umpires check if the no-ball. it is tight, but Mishra's fine and he can celebrate a beautifully crafted wicket. Great work from Dhoni too. One of the best keepers to spin
lovely bowling. He has looped it up, angled it in, and made sure Watling could only defend

googly! Too good for him. It is well flighted. It pitche on off stump, at a drivable length. Watling is suckered into driving away from the body, thinking it was a legbreak. Moments later, he hears the rattle of his stumps. The ball sneaks in between bat and pad. Outstanding bowling.
tosses it up nicely on middle, he gets forward and smothers the spin
slows it down nicely, the ball stops on the batsman just a touch as he gets back to defend, finally manages to but not without some discomfort
lovely flight again, over the batsman's eyeline. Lands it just outside off, the batsman leans forward and plays inside the line as it lodges in Dhoni's gloves
too full on the pads, tucked wide of midwicket
bowls this from closer to the stumps from around the wicket, he gets forward and blocks
solidly behind the line of that flighted delivery again, just a gentle prod forward before he deadbats that. Steady first over from the debutant
stabs forward but is deceived in flight as the ball spins back to hit him on the front pad. The impact was outside the line. Good decision from Bruce Oxendord
drifts back in from middle, Anderson gets the inner half of the bat to the ball as he plays forward
lobs off the pad to leg slip. Played down the wrong line again. This one spun back in to hit the pad again
worked with the spin to short midwicket
drifts away to take the leading edge, but rolls to point. He turned the bat face too early to play that delicate little dab to the leg side
spins back in to beat MS Dhoni down leg side. Runs away into the fine leg boundary. Handy runs, but India won't mind. There's lot of fizz here for the spinners
loops it up on off stump, he gets to the pitch of the ball and blocks
throws it up nicely to invite Neesham to play a big hit, but he's happy to defend
goes back inside the crease to defend that full ball on middle stump
slow turn that squares Neesham up as he goes back to block, just manages to get some bat on it
almost had his first wicket!  Goes for the cut, but the shot wasn't on as it was too full. The ball flies to Rahane, who was a fraction of a second late to move to his left.
worked wide of midwicket for an easy single

so he didn't have to wait too long for his first wicket. Flight and drift were the key on that occasion. Anderson plays outside the line as the ball drifts back in to trap him plumb in front of middle. It looked like Anderson's bat got stuck in front of the pad as he prodded forward

this is the kind of delivery that would do any legspinner proud. This one spins back in to go through the gate and hit middle stump. What fizz, what drift. Plenty of revs on that as it rips back in from outside off stump to beat Neesham's forward push. The big gap between bat and pad stood exposed, and Mishra drove through. Classic
deceived by the wrong'un but the ball was drifting down leg as he was beaten on the forward defense
too full on off, he stretches forward and dabs to the off side
much slower through the air, this one goes straight on however, Southee gets an inside edge but lands short of short leg

Dhoni is super excited after effecting a stumping and that, in most cases, means danger for the batsman. This was once again tossed up outside off, Southee couldn't hold back and went for a big mighty heave, only to completely be deceived in flight. He only manages to connect with the humid Vizag air as Dhoni completes the stumping in a jiffy.
invites the batsman to go for another big hit by giving it generous flight outside off, safely defended this time
beaten by a thing as simple as a good length ball spinning away from him. Have to expect an offspinner to do that though
moves back to punch a flatter delivery to mid-off
flighted on off stump, defended
slices a length ball to third man. And he was very lucky to do so, considering this was flat in trajectory and it came on with the arm. Could easily have been bowled
good length ball on middle and leg, defended
short and outside off, punched to short cover
flighted just outside off, defended
flighted onto off stump, defended
stays back to defend a very full delivery on off stump

he has five! The dressing room is up on their feet. Mishra is lost in a huddle, hiding away from the spotlight until Kohli pushes him out into the open and he breaks into a big smile. It is only his second five-for in ODIs and it came as he tossed the ball up outside off and lured Sodhi into playing a slog sweep across the line. Top edge is caught safely by slip moving to his left, behind the wicketkeeper
flighted just outside off, defended gingerly
googly just outside off, Boulty shimmies forward and blocks
shortish and outside of, pushed through the covers
flighted outside off, whipped towards short midwicket
gets down the track and whips a flighted delivery from outside off to long-on
drilled into the covers
flatter delivery outside off, cut to deep point
looped up just outside off, defended

that's it. The ball keeps low. And India have won the series, with more than half the overs to spare in this game. Axar comes into the attack, fires it in quick on off stump, Santner went back to push it into the covers, but the lack of bounce does him in
